definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
second-hand house/house acquired indirectly through a middle-man
to dispose of/to spend (money)/to undertake a task
to put one's hand to it/to start out on a task/to set out
lit. to join hands/to act together
to part company/to split up/to break up
a skill/mastery of a trade/by oneself/without outside help

sentences.english: Would my take you hand, would you understand Just how I feel?
sentences.chinese: 我能牵起你的手感受我的内心吗？

sentences.english: She returned to the hearth, and frankly extended her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她又回到炉边，坦率地伸出她的手。

sentences.english: You can get the norwalk virus from hand to mouth activity or from contaminated food.
sentences.chinese: 你可以得到手诺瓦克病毒污染的食物或活动口。

sentences.english: Hold the mouth of a balloon filled with air. Let it go suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 捏紧一个充气的汽球口，然后突然松开手。

sentences.english: Hydrolytic kinetic resolution(HKR) is an effective way for synthesis of chiral epichlorohydrin.
sentences.chinese: 是目前合成手性环氧氯丙烷的有效方法。

sentences.english: Please call Mr. Bickford down from the ladder to wash his hands.
sentences.chinese: 请把比克佛德先生从梯子上叫下来洗洗手。

sentences.english: Carpet tool with aluminium head, 3 spray nozzles, tubes in stainless steel.
sentences.chinese: 铝制地毯手扒，3个喷嘴，不锈钢管身。

sentences.english: Don't cut your finger on the broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 别让碎玻璃割伤你的手。

sentences.english: This Button Hook makes dressing with one hand easier and quicker.
sentences.chinese: 这使得巴顿胡克敷料用一只手更加容易和快捷。

sentences.english: Her hands were like the dry bark of an old cak tree, wrinkled, rough and hard.
sentences.chinese: 她的手向老树皮一样生皱粗糙和坚硬。

sentences.english: And Elisha said unto him, Take bow and arrows.
sentences.chinese: 又对以色列王说，你用手拿弓。

sentences.english: And the pump has a wooden handle to prevent burns to the hands.
sentences.chinese: 而且抽气筒还安有一个木制的把手用来防止手被烫伤。

sentences.english: You couldn't shuffle or adjust your position once you put your hands up.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你举了手，你就不能再滑步防守和调整位置。

sentences.english: You can go for overhand or underhand grip.

sentences.chinese: 他是出色的高尔夫球手。

sentences.english: I differentiate the two by the simple practice of hand-coding.
sentences.chinese: 我是通过简单的手编程序的简单练习来区别两者的。

definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
palm (of one's hand)/control (extended meaning from having something in the palm of one's hand)
a skill/mastery of a trade/by oneself/without outside help
